title: Art Insights: John Singer Sargent, Bon Vivant
hero_caption: John Singer Sargent. The Fountain, Villa Torlonia, Frascati, Italy, 1907. Friends of American Art Collection.
description:
Art Insights provides a historical and enlightening art-enrichment experience for older members of the community who are unable to visit the Art Institute in person. The Art Institute is pleased to partner with Mather Lifeways Telephone Topics to provide telephone-based Art Insights conversations from the comfort of your home. To participate in this program, you will need a telephone and will receive a printed or electronic handout prior to the event.

Sargent painted portraits of the most prominent members of society during the late nineteenth century. He enjoyed life to the fullest—and was not without scandal. Join us for a fun discussion led by volunteer lecturer David Williams about Sargent's life, and take a peek at a few of his best known works on display in John Singer Sargent and Chicago's Gilded Age through September 30.

*This telephone presentation is presented in partnership with Mather Lifeways. For more information or to register, please call (888) 600-2560, e-mail teltopics@matherlifeways.com, or visit www.matherlifeways.com.

Art Insights is generously funded by the Hulda B. and Maurice L. Rothschild Foundation.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an email to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
